title: Ticket #3193: support evaluated expressions in xml query output
description:
Currently there is no way to specify that you want an expression to be evaluated when generating -xml or -long output from condor_q and condor_status. This seems an arbitrary limitation, since one can get evaluated output when using -format in non-xml mode.

Currently, the list of attributes to include in the long/xml output is specified via the -attributes argument. One possible solution would be to add a new option -expressions that lists expressions to be evaluated. Perhaps the following syntax would make sense, where each expression is assigned a name that will be used as the attribute name in the output: 

    -expressions name1=expr1;name2=expr2;...

If multiple -expressions are specified, they will be appended to the list of expressions.
